row.FL: Association Network Member;Association Members Council;Association Management Board

FL.val: I have read & agree to the statutes

row.FL:
As a Councillor, I believe that I can represent the interests of you: the Network Members, the institutes that share collections and information in the Europeana portal. Working in a museum (and having worked as an adviser for libraries and archives before I started at the Rijksmuseum) I know how difficult it is to digitize, metadata, share, translate, innovate and learn about copyright. All the new information that you have to learn when you want to put your collections online.
At the Rijksmuseum, we had to start somewhere. And with the help of colleagues in other museums and Europeana we learned so much about opening up and sharing our collections. As a Councillor, I will share our knowledge and experiences with the Network Members.
I think the next ten years will be crucial for further development of digital heritage and digital (art) history. We only recently started sharing our information and images online. How will our resources be used? What applications, new questions, new perspectives, new knowledge will emerge? How can our digital artifacts influence a global digital world and how does this world influence us, our collections and our perspectives on our organizations? At the Rijksmuseum, we truly transformed into a global museum with half of our online and onsite visitors coming from abroad.
There is no other network like the Europeana Network where heritage professionals from many different countries and institutions TOGETHER try to shape their own future and as a Councillor I would like to work with you all in shaping this future, and help to keep it understandable and manageable for us all!

FL.val: I have read & agree to the statutes

row.FL:
I have run the office of the Association of European Film Archives and Cinémathèques (ACE) since 2004. Many of the ACE members are connected to Europeana via the European Film Gateway. I strongly believe in the political idea to unite Europe through culture and that unlocking Europe's cultural heritage can be a catalyst for societal and economic change. I will support Europeana and its Network in making this idea come true, but also be a critical voice on how things can be achieved.
As a councillor, I would like to strengthen the bond between the audiovisual / film heritage sector and Europeana in general, but also particularly try to engage the sector more strongly in the Europeana Network and its efforts. Also, I'd love to bring in my experience gained as secretary of ACE in awareness raising and advocacy work towards the European Commission and other policy makers regarding a copyright reform that facilitates access to Europe's cultural heritage.
Together with the colleagues of the Europeana Network, I will work to further push these and other issues we share with cultural institutions in Europe.

FL.val: I have read & agree to the statutes

row.FL: Technical Coordinator for the Archives Portal Europe

I have been involved in the development of the European archives domain aggregator for the last five years, covering all different types of tasks from R&D with a special emphasis on international archival standards, involvement in defining technical requirements and accompanying their implementation from a business point of view, via user evaluation, PR and Linked Data strategies to interoperability questions on all levels with Europeana and other European cultural heritage projects.
As a Councillor, you can expect of me to aim at promoting the importance of archives material for the Europeana portal and vice versa as well as strengthening the bond between archives and the Europeana Network.
As the Work Package lead on Interoperability for the Archives Portal Europe, it is my firm belief, that by sharing our diverse backgrounds and experiences in the Network we can jointly have a huge impact on how the digital cultural heritage of Europe can be used and re-used in all possible contexts and to the benefits of all involved - including ourselves as "re-users".

FL.val: I have read & agree to the statutes

row.FL:
As a councillor I would like to work with Europeana to promote a strong, positive vision of the digital public domain in Europe.
In particular I would like to see progress in two main areas.
Firstly, I would like to see openness becoming the default for the release of digital material from cultural heritage institutions. This would build on the work of the OpenGLAM network (which I initiated), as well as Europeana's existing work in this area.
Secondly, I would like to see greater awareness of the importance of the public domain as a public good. I would like to contribute to better narratives around why it is important - as well as to strategies for engaging new audiences around the digital commons. For example, I would like to help to enlist support from public intellectuals for the digital public domain, as we have done with the Public Domain Review (which I co-founded).

FL.val: I have read & agree to the statutes

row.FL: I would like to use my position as Management Board Member to participate in discussions with the European Education Community about the opportunities and challenges of Europeana collection for stimulating educational innovation.
Association Network Member;Association Management Board;Association Members Council

FL.val: I have read & agree to the statutes

row.FL: Netherlands Institute for Sound and Vision
Manager of the Knowledge & Innovation department

As councillor, I will passionately work with colleagues in the network to make Europeana's vision come true. Together, we can create an open, connected and smart environment in which our collections and knowledge thrive.
Specifically, I will commit to three topics that contribute to reaching Europeana's goal to ‘transform the world with culture':
Raising awareness in the audiovisual domain. Europeana is a source of inspiration for the creative industries (including broadcasting), something that should be exploited more.
Open by default. We need to measure the impact of open content distribution (f.i. more user participation) and influence policy making in this area in our institutions.
Massive engagement within the network. We need to work on a joint strategy how the success of Europeana adds to the success of contributing partners.
Over the past two years, I was fortunate enough to serve as one of the network officers for Europeana. In this position, I contributed to shaping the current Strategic Plan. Through my direct involvement in both EUscreen and Europeana Sounds, I have a good understanding of incentives from (audiovisual) content providers to participate in the network. Involvement in Europeana Space and Europeana Creative helped me to understand the position of commercial stakeholders who like using cultural assets.
Europeana is a main driver for innovation in our sector; I once dubbed it the innovative 'hadron collider' for Europe's cultural sector. I hope the network gives me the opportunity to continue contributing to Europeana and its bold, ambitious goal!
Association Network Member;Association Management Board;Association Members Council

FL.val: I have read & agree to the statutes

row.FL: Head of department of Digital Asset Management and New Media

As a councillor, I would like to contribute to the future of Europeana from Museums collections, literature and digitization perspective. I have been involved in Europeana related projects like Open up!, BHL-Europe, and I am currently involved Athena plus, Synthesis 3 and as leader of Natural history education pilot in Europeana Creative project. Because of my Museums and Natural History background (PhD in Palaeontology) I would like to highlight the Museums collections content representing the cultural heritage and treasure cross domain and their visibility, access and potential of reuse by research/scientific community, education sector/academics, general public and creative industry.
I would be also very interested to follow up on the digitization and Natural History contributions and collaborations with this community and also focus on the strengthen the collaboration with partners outside the Europe. In this aspect it can help my vice chair position in Global Biodiversity Heritage Library consortium, which includes nodes from China, Australia, Africa, Egypt, Singapore, Europe, South and North America. I am also representing the BHL Europe node and actively contributing in several working groups within Consortium of European Taxonomic Facilities (CETAF).
In the National Museum I am coordinating collections digital evidence, digitization, publication and presentation (online or via the physical exhibitions). My department in NM also coordinate the national level aggregator platform eSbírky.cz, which is currently providing the content to Europeana via the Athena plus project.

FL.val: I have read & agree to the statutes

row.FL:
As a counsellor, I intend to assist in the further development of the mission of Europeana by contributing my expertise and connections in the Natural History Domain.
My focus is on (1) open and free sharing of Europeana content, (2) identifying synergies with other platforms and initiatives as well as with industrial partners, and (3) facilitating an improved user experience through rich metadata provision and automated enrichment.
In the last five years, I worked in a number of Europeana-related projects such as BHL-Europe, OpenUp! and Europeana Creative. I am familiar with the perspectives of the content provider, the aggregator and the user and was involved in setting up challenging new partnerships with the Creative Industries targeting the re-use of Europeana content.
However, my interest is not limited to the Natural History domain. Working at an institution which houses not only zoological, paleontological and mineralogical collections but also a library and historical archive, has made me appreciate the importance of a special focus on bridging the gap between specimen collections, libraries and archives and on finding possible cross-domain approaches to present and connect Europeana content.

FL.val: I have read & agree to the statutes

row.FL:
As a councillor I will promote the importance of local heritage for Europeana, and vice versa. Most of the contributors to our aggregator Erfgoedplus.be are local heritage communities and the related experience has been most relevant to the projects EuropeanaLocal, EuropeanaAwareness and LoCloud. However, Europeana still lacks the means to approach the small contributors at their own level.
Typically such local contributors require much support and assistance beyond the technical infrastructure which is currently offered.
In the context of local collections, ‘data quality' acquires a very different profile than considered till now.
These issues have broader relevance than Europeana. By addressing them properly, Europeana can make a major contribution to the domain of digital cultural heritage, beyond being a portal. It would make a big step towards becoming a true platform for improving knowledge about cultural heritage.

FL.val: I have read & agree to the statutes

row.FL:
As a councillor I will work to raise awareness of the open access movement and use my experience in policy development to advise and persuade GLAMs how to license their collections so that they are open.
I will inform others of the risks and benefits of open, the challenges and techniques to overcoming them. I want to help GLAMs "release content into the wild".

FL.val: I have read & agree to the statutes

row.FL:
I work at Net7 srl, an Italian SME developing linked data application for Cultural Heritage. I have a PhD in Political Philosophy and in the past ten years I worked as a Researcher, focusing my research on Web science, and in particular on Open access, Linked Data, Digital Libraries.
As a Councilor, I would like to contribute to the discussion about opening contents and services to European citizens, by creating new tools and services dedicated to different audiences. I would like to discuss about and find ways to exploit the innovation potential of the European digital assets. Moreover, I would like to contribute to the definition of new publication and evaluation models for scholarly communication, in particular in the SSH, relating this reflection to the Europeana environment.

FL.val: I have read & agree to the statutes

row.FL:
Dia duit! I believe I have a real contribution to make as a Councillor. As a Councilor, I will work with the Network to develop new creative connections between people and heritage. In the coming years Europeana needs to continue developing a strong network of partnerships with industry, not being afraid to ask and answer the tough questions around rights, ownership and access. We also need to deepen our connection to heritage institutions, working with the sector to articulate not only what "data providers" can do for Europeana, but the practical and inspirational value that the Europeana ecosystem can bring to the entire heritage field.
I look forward to bringing my experience of working at the Europeana Foundation, my experience as a member of the creative industries, my experience at heritage institutions and my experience of commercial and non-commercial management to promote the aims and objectives of Europeana.

FL.val: I have read & agree to the statutes
